Key Match Events: Bronny James made his debut and led the Lakers with a game-high three blocks.
Bronny James scored his lone bucket with 56.2 seconds left, a driving layup.
Max Christie posted 11 points, seven rebounds, two assists, one steal, and two blocks in a game-high 34 minutes.
Dalton Knecht tied Reaves with a team-leading 16 points on 7-for-13 shooting, adding three rebounds, two assists, one steal, and one block.
Post-Match Reflections: JJ Redick praised Bronny James for his defensive instincts and athleticism.
JJ Redick expressed satisfaction with Bronny James' progress.
Max Christie reflected on his performance, noting it was a culmination of his hard work over the past two months.
JJ Redick praised Max Christie for his maturity and competitiveness.
JJ Redick highlighted Dalton Knecht's defensive effort and his potential role in the rotation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers emphasized increasing their 3-point volume, attempting 32 three-pointers in the game.
